channel.title: sendMessage problem
channel.description:
Hey I am trying to get it to when you type in this command it yells a message. This is code I'm using: [code=java]
c2.sendMessage("Server Double Exp is ON! by " + c.playerName+ "." ); [/code] The hole code: [code=java]
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("startdouble")) { doubleExperience = true; c.sendMessage("Double EXP is ON"); c2.sendMessage("Server Double Exp is ON! by " + c.playerName + "." ); [/code]
My error: [code=batch] src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:607: cannot find symbol symbol : variable c2 location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands
c2.sendMessage("Server Double Exp is ON! by " + c.player Name + "." );
^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:613: cannot find symbol symbol : variable c2 location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands
c2.sendMessage("Server Double Exp is OFF! by " + c.playe rName + "." );
^ [/code]

item.title: sendMessage problem
item.dc:creator: @escalation escalation
item.description:
@escalation wrote:

Thanks it worked.
Repped.

Read full topic

item.title: sendMessage problem
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

My bad rofl I guess i deleted it… Here.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("startdouble")) { for (int j = 0; j < PlayerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (PlayerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)PlayerHandler.players[j]; doubleExperience = true; c.sendMessage("Double EXP is ON"); c2.sendMessage("Server Double Exp is ON! by " + c.playerName + "." ); } } }

Read full topic

item.title: sendMessage problem
item.dc:creator: @escalation escalation
item.description:
@escalation wrote:

Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players

This part is giving me problems. It says there should be a “;” at the end of it… when I add it the error says:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:607: inconvertible types
found   : server.model.players.Player[]
required: server.model.players.Client
                         Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players;
                                                                 ^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:617: inconvertible types
found   : server.model.players.Player[]
required: server.model.players.Client
                         Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players;
                                                                 ^
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“escalation, post:10, topic:410291”]First I adding in my command what you said, then I put this:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("startdouble")) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; doubleExperience = true; c.sendMessage("Double EXP is ON"); c2.sendMessage("Server Double Exp is ON! by " + c.playerName + "." ); [/quote]
Did you even add any brackets to close the command? Should be 3 brackets closing the statement.

item.title: sendMessage problem
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“dun dun dun, post:6, topic:410291”] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("startdouble")) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; doubleExperience = true; c.sendMessage("Double EXP is ON"); c2.sendMessage("Server Double Exp is ON! by " + c.playerName + "." );[/quote]
Hint: Don’t use Server.playerHandler.players because it should be called in a static way. Learned that from Eclipse :).

PlayerHandler.players is better.

Read full topic
